thread.title: Joy as Bournemouth midfielder Harry Arter and partner Rachel welcome new baby Raine
thread.title_full: Joy as Bournemouth midfielder Harry Arter and partner Rachel welcome new baby Raine

author: smorgan
title: Joy as Bournemouth midfielder Harry Arter and partner Rachel welcome new baby Raine
text:
'Artwarming Joy as Bournemouth midfielder Harry Arter and partner Rachel welcome new baby Raine 
The Republic of Ireland star suffered the tragedy of a stillborn birth in December 2015 and was targeted by vile troll but now has reason to celebrate By Sam Morgan Comments HARRY ARTER and partner Rachel have welcomed new baby Raine Renne into their family. 
The Bournemouth midfielder and his fiancee suffered the heartbreak of a stillborn birth in December 2015. Getty Images Harry Arter and fiancee Rachel have welcomed the birth of baby daughter Raine Harry Arter/Instagram 5 Harry Arterâ€™s touching Instagram post confirmed the birth of his child Thrilled with the incredible news @HarryArter2 and Rachel have a baby daughter Raine. With Fondest Love from us all ğŸ¾ğŸŒˆ 
â€” Jeff Mostyn (@jeffmostyn) February 18, 2017 
And Arter paid tribute to tragic Renee in an Instagram post announcing the birth of his daughter. 
He wrote: â€œA rainbow baby is the understanding that the beauty of a rainbow does not negate the ravage of a storm. 
â€œWhen the rainbow appears, it doesnâ€™t mean the storm never happened or that the family is now dealing with its aftermath. 
â€œWhat is means is that something beautiful and full of light has appeared in the midst of the darkest clouds.â€ 
Bournemouth chairman Jeff Mostyn congratulated the couple on the birth. ğŸ‘¶ 
â€” AFC Bournemouth ğŸ’ (@afcbournemouth) February 18, 2017 Pep Guardiola makes heartwarming gesture to Harry Arter after midfielderâ€™s painful loss 
He tweeted: "Thrilled with the incredible news @HarryArter2 and Rachel have a baby daughter Raine. With Fondest Love from us all." 
Arter was met on the pitch by Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola after City's 2-0 win at Dean Court earlier this month.
